tobj.lexer¶

Lexer for TOBJ

This module contains the Lexer responsible for converting TinyObj source code into a sequence of tokens.

Attributes¶

STAR

ARROW

DASH

IDENTIFIER

STRING

NUMBER

BOOLEAN

NOTHING

NEWLINE

EOF

WHITESPACE

Classes¶

Token

A single TinyObj token, representing a meaningful unit in the source code.

Lexer

The TinyObj Lexer (scanner).

Functions¶

main()

Example usage of the Lexer.

class tobj.lexer.Token(type: str, value: str | None, pos_start: tobj.errors.Position, pos_end: tobj.errors.Position)[source]¶

A single TinyObj token, representing a meaningful unit in the source code.

Parameters:

  • type (str) – The token type (e.g., STAR, NUMBER, IDENTIFIER).

  • value (Optional[str]) – The literal value of the token, if applicable.

  • pos_start (Position) – The starting position of the token in the source.

  • pos_end (Position) – The position immediately after the last character of the token.

type[source]¶
value[source]¶
pos_start[source]¶
pos_end[source]¶
__repr__() → str[source]¶

Returns a string representation of the token for debugging.

class tobj.lexer.Lexer(text: str, filename: str = '<string>')[source]¶

The TinyObj Lexer (scanner).

It takes raw TinyObj text and converts it into a list of Token objects.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – The full source code text.

  • filename (str) – The name of the source file. Defaults to ‘<string>’.

Variables:

  • pos (Position) – The current position in the source text.

  • current_char (Optional[str]) – The character at the current position, or None if EOF.

text: str[source]¶
pos: tobj.errors.Position[source]¶
current_char: str | None[source]¶
advance() → None[source]¶

Moves the lexer’s position to the next character and updates current_char.

peek(offset: int = 1) → str | None[source]¶

Looks ahead at a character without advancing the position.

Parameters:

offset (int) – How many characters to look ahead. Defaults to 1.

Returns:

The character at the peeked position, or None if past EOF.

Return type:

Optional[str]

skip_whitespace() → None[source]¶

Skips all standard horizontal whitespace characters (but NOT newlines!).

skip_comment() → None[source]¶

Skips characters from the current position until a newline character or EOF.

tokenize() → List[Token][source]¶

The main tokenization loop. Reads the source code and produces a list of Tokens.

Returns:

A list of all tokens found in the source code, ending with an EOF token.

Return type:

List[Token]

Raises:

LexerError – If an unterminated string is found or an unexpected character is encountered.

tobj.lexer.main()[source]¶

Example usage of the Lexer.
